Title: Between Putin and Trump, a similarity born of hatred, contempt and revisionism
Subhead: Both ideologically and in the methods they used to achieve their goals, the Russian and American presidents display similarities that spark grave concerns for democracy across the Atlantic.

Title: Ukraine seeks countermeasures against Russian drones equipped with Starlink
Vietnam harbors a profound strategic distrust of the US
French prosecutors request Le Pen's election ban be upheld
Subhead: Last year, far-right party leader Marine Le Pen was convicted of embezzling EU Parliament funds. She is appealing against the conviction and the sentence that would ban her from running in the presidential election.

Title: Ayana V. Jackson, photographing resistance at the Galerie Mariane Ibrahim in Paris
Subhead: The Black contemporary artist draws on archives and books to create narratives with historical and political messages.

Title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Artificial snow takes a toll on the environment
Subhead: The Milan Cortina Olympic Games are no exception: Artificial snowmaking will be used almost everywhere. This technology, which requires large amounts of water and energy, has led to major infrastructure changes that have been criticized by environmental advocates and scientists.

Title: Javier Cercas: 'Like the Spanish Civil War, the war in Ukraine is a European war'
Subhead: The recipient of the 2025 Jacques Delors Prize asks whether the conflict in Ukraine is not the contemporary equivalent of the struggle between Republicans and Francoists in the 1930s â€“ in other words, the prologue to a new world war.

Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
Subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

Title: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
Subhead: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

Title: A bike journey across crisis-ridden Cuba under the watchful eye of state security
Subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (3/3). Le Monde reporters left Havana by bicycle to discover this country where people, under constant surveillance, have learned to survive through resourcefulness and the black market.

Title: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'

Title: France closes the 2026 budget chapter, at last
